blackrock-tableau-dashboard.title: BlackRock Tableau Dashboard
blackrock-tableau-dashboard.desc: In the summer of 2020, I interned with BlackRock where I got to process portfolio model data and display it visually within an interactive Tableau dashboard.

workout-application.title: Workout Application
workout-application.desc: I was a part of a team of 5 students to design and create a workout tracker app written in React Native.

operating-system-tinkering.title: Operating System Tinkering
operating-system-tinkering.desc: I had the opportunity to dive into the workings of an operating system and low-level coding, having done projects to put my knowledge to the test.

ti-tiva-launchpad-games.title: TI Tiva Launchpad Games
ti-tiva-launchpad-games.desc: I created 2 games written in C that ran on a Tiva Launchpad. This involved understanding low-level software and hardware communication interfaces such as UART, SPI, I2C, CAN, and more.

artificial-intelligence-projects.title: Artificial Intelligence Projects
artificial-intelligence-projects.desc: During a summer class (CS 540: Intro to AI), I had the opportunity to work on a couple projects that put what was taught in class into practice.

java-programs-and-applications.title: Java Programs and Applications
java-programs-and-applications.desc: Within 2 of my computer science classes, I was able to explore programming concepts with Java, including data structures, object oriented programming, and more.

mips-16-bit-5-stage-pipelined-microproce.title: MIPS 16-bit 5-stage Pipelined Microprocessor
mips-16-bit-5-stage-pipelined-microproce.desc: I and my partner in ECE 552: Intro to Computer Architecture, designed our very own MIPS 16-bit 5-stage pipelined microprocessor with forwarding enabled and cache in System Verilog.

convolutional-neural-network-hardware-ac.alt: Convolutional Neural Network Hardware Accelerator Logo
convolutional-neural-network-hardware-ac.title: Convolutional Neural Network Hardware Accelerator
convolutional-neural-network-hardware-ac.desc: I worked within a team of 5 other students to build out a Convolutional Neural Network Hardware Accelerator, designed to be able to do the required matrix math efficiently with pre-trained values.
